Israeli reservists called up to Gaza torn between doubt and duty
subhead: Tens of thousands of reservists have been called up to carry out Israel's ground offensive in Gaza City. A minority have refused, questioning the aims of a war that began two years ago after the attack by Hamas. Others have responded without hesitation.

French and American far right gather in Paris for Charlie Kirk commemoration
subhead: On Friday, nearly 250 people gathered in Paris to honor the memory of the pro-Trump activist who was killed on September 10. As with the vigils held in the US, the gathering in Paris combined political and religious rhetoric.

title: Trump and Xi set to meet as TikTok deal nears resolution
subhead: Following their phone conversation on September 19, the presidents of the United States and China, the world's two leading powers, have signaled a willingness to open dialogue and ease tensions between their countries.

title: England beats France 35-17 in Women's Rugby World Cup semi-final
subhead: England, into their seventh final in a row – but beaten in five of the last six by New Zealand – will now face Canada in next Saturday's final.

title: The silent and destructive spread of laughing gas: 'That shit took my whole life'
subhead: A boy barely out of his teens, a man not yet 30, a young nursing assistant, a father: All share how their lives have been shattered by nitrous oxide. This legal, inexpensive and easily accessible substance has become a widely consumed and addictive drug.

Who is Gabriel Zucman, billionaires' nightmare?
subhead: Since Sébastien Lecornu's appointment as prime minister, Gabriel Zucman's name has been everywhere in French media. The economist's proposal for a 2% wealth tax on the ultra-rich has returned to the forefront of public debate.

title: Macron and PM Lecornu keep low profiles amid social unrest
subhead: The silence from the top of the French state, as two waves of social protest erupted in eight days, gave opposition parties and labor unions free rein to challenge the prime minister and influence the agenda of his future government.

title: Why prosecutors want PSG's Achraf Hakimi to stand trial for rape
subhead: Prosecutors requested in August that PSG's vice-captain stand trial for rape, according to a final indictment seen by Le Monde.
